IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Assist persons with serious mental illness
IRS990.MissionDescription: Assist persons with serious mental illness
IRS990.Description: Residential Rehabilitation Program - provides community support, general housing and intensive housing services. The program is organized to assist people to live as independently as possible through the provision of training, supervision and assistance in the skills of community living. Staffing is available at the different sites ranging from drop-in to 24 hour per day support.

Activity2.Description: Vocational Programs - provide vocational services including the Back to Work program and the Employment Focus Cluster program. These programs provide a range of vocational services including vocational assessment and planning services, supported employment job search and coaching services, work adjustment training, job placement and employee support services.

Activity3.Description: Clinic - provides psychiatric therapy and medication services. The program is organized to provide continuity and integrated care for existing St. Luke's clients that choose to utilize the Clinic services. In addition, the individual therapy, group therapy and medication services are available to anyone in the community in need of such services.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Board Designated Endowment Funds are to be used as a reserve for replacements at Southport Center and as a reserve for future improvements to property and equipment.The Temporary Endowment Funds are to be used for the purchase of a defibrillator and for Career Transition Program initiatives.The Permanent Endowment Funds are to be used to establish an endowment to honor Joan Clement, past president/CEO of St. Luke's House. St. Luke's House intends to reinvest the earnings from any investments purchased until the endowment reaches $200,000. Once this level is attained, all earnings from investments shall be treated as unrestricted support and will be available for use at the direction of the Board of Directors.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: health care services rendered to patients

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The documents are available on our common drive to employees 24/7. They are available to the public upon request and they are available via http://www2.guidestar.org/.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Market survey of similar positions in similar industries is performed. Final compensation amounts are approved by the Board.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: It is reviewed by the finance director and CEO for accuracy and completeness.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: More than one member of a family works within the organization but not within the same department.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Community Rehabilitation Program (Life Skills) - provides outpatient rehabilitation training, seminars and social/recreational activities to assist people in developing independent living skills and community integration skills. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: Career Transition Program - provides a unique combination of mental health and career/vocational resources to assist students and their families in identifying and obtaining necessary resources to assist in a successful transition from school to work or post-secondary academic environments. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 6: Crisis Residential Program (McAuliffe House) - provides a community-based residential alternative to inpatient hospitalization; located in a group home setting; provides intensive 24 hours per day staff supervision to help people in psychiatric crisis to become stabilized and return to normal life routines as quickly as possible. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 7: Supported Living Programs - Provides counseling and independent living skills training to people living in their own homes in the community. The program is organized to assist people to live as independently as possible through the provision of training, supervision and assistance in the skills of community living. Staff support is provided according to specific client needs.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Assist persons with serious mental illness.
Assist persons with serious mental illness.
